column4: I get a  "Permission denied (publickey)"  when i try to ssh into my ubuntu server... what could cause this? my public key is already in authorized_keys file
ummm permission issue on the file ~/.ssh/*
the permissions for all the files are -rw-r--r--
is that what its suppose to be?
ohh and they are owned by root
no.   you should own them and they should not be readable by anyone else.
I am root. (i'm still setting it up)
but is this really what's causing me to not be able to log in?
not sure...    but ssh will not read config files that are toooooo permisc.
what should I chmod them to?
the dir   to      700   the files to    600
actually as root      000   will work.   root needs no permission at all.
